intro: Holothrix elgonensis, commonly known as the East African holothrix, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Uganda and Kenya. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas at elevations above 2,000 meters. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
